description: An unusually late constructed shrine of timber and turf. The shrine had a period of reconstruction in 390 - 400 CE involving the laying of a flint and tile platform.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Great Dunmow (Essex).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Smith, Alex. “The Fate of Pagan Temples in South-East Britain.” In Ritual Landsacpes of South-East Britain, edited by David Rudling, 2008.
